text: Stanley Baldwin received numerous honours in recognition of her career in politics. These included: ==Hereditary Peerage== Baldwin was elevated to the House of Lords on 8 June 1937, upon his Standing Down as Leader of the Conservative Party and from his seat in the House of Commons. He Took the Title Earl Baldwin of Bewdley, with the Subsidiary title of Viscount Corvedale, of Corvedale in the County of Salop. He sat with the Conservative Party Benches. ==Coat of arms== As a member of the House of Lords with a Hereditary peerage, Baldwin was entitled to use a personal coat of arms. ==Commonwealth honours== ;Commonwealth Realms {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" !
